preconditions.description: All dependent UoWs must be completed
Foundation layer services must be available
Precondition from AC-001: 검증할 데이터가 준비된 상태에서
Precondition from AC-002: 설정 가능한 환경이 준비된 상태에서
Precondition from AC-003: 설정 가능한 환경이 준비된 상태에서
Precondition from AC-004: 시스템이 정상적으로 동작하는 상태에서

postconditions.description: Result from AC-001: 검증 결과가 올바르게 반환되어야 한다
Additional condition from AC-001: 입력값이 유효성 검사를 통과해야 한다
Result from AC-002: 설정이 올바르게 적용되어야 한다
Additional condition from AC-002: 성능 요구사항이 충족되어야 한다
Additional condition from AC-002: 오류 처리가 적절해야 한다
Result from AC-003: 설정이 올바르게 적용되어야 한다
Additional condition from AC-003: 성능 요구사항이 충족되어야 한다
Additional condition from AC-003: 오류 처리가 적절해야 한다
Result from AC-004: Comprehensive error handling and detailed messages
success_criteria: Comprehensive error handling and detailed messages

postconditions.description: Additional condition from AC-004: 결과가 예상된 형태로 반환되어야 한다
Additional condition from AC-004: 시스템 상태가 일관성을 유지해야 한다

side_effects.description: Updates system state as specified in acceptance criteria

scenarios.name: Validate Standard project layout with clear directory structure
Validate Architecture layers clearly defined and documented
Validate Module interfaces defined for dependency injection
Validate Documentation structure and standards established
Validate Correlation IDs across service boundaries
Validate Core dependencies installed (framework, database, cache)
Validate Development tools configured (testing, linting, security)
Validate Version pinning for reproducible builds
Validate Structured error responses with correlation IDs
Validate Error categorization and HTTP status mapping
Validate Retry mechanisms for transient failures
Validate Circuit breaker patterns for external deps
Validate HTTP client with circuit breaker and retry
Validate API response caching and validation
Validate Rate limiting for external API calls
Validate Fallback strategies and error handling
Validate Cache client configuration with connection pooling
Validate Cache operations (CRUD) with error handling
Validate TTL management and cache invalidation strategies
Validate Connection resilience and fallback mechanisms
Validate Integration testing setup with test containers
Validate Coverage reporting and thresholds configured
Validate Structured configuration with schema validation
Validate Hot-reload capability without service restart
Validate Comprehensive validation and error reporting
Validate HTTP server setup with configurable middleware
Validate Security headers and rate limiting middleware
Validate Request/response logging with structured format
Validate Graceful shutdown and connection draining
Validate Automated testing on pull requests
Validate Code quality gates with linting
Validate Database connection pool management with health monitoring
Validate Transaction support with proper error handling
Validate Connection resilience and automatic reconnection
Validate Business rules implementation with validation
Validate Input sanitization and output encoding
Validate Error handling with business-specific codes
Validate Comprehensive audit trail for operations
Validate Cross-field validation and dependency checking
Validate Business rule validation (ports, URLs, formats)
Validate Validation error reporting with field specifics
Validate Session management with secure storage
Validate Audit logging for authentication events
Validate Load and validate configuration files against schema
Validate Support for environment-specific configuration resolution
Validate Configuration caching and reload capability
Validate Comprehensive error handling and detailed messages
Validate Multi-stage Docker build with optimized size
Validate Security hardening with non-root execution
Validate Health check integration and readiness probes
Validate Job retry and dead letter queue handling
Validate Task status tracking and monitoring
Validate Hot-reload capability without service interruption
Validate Configuration backup and rollback capability
